MC.content: [Nietzsche’s etymologizing in On Genealogy] méchance (mean, bad, low): bad luck; malchance: Austin’s “infelicity,” parasite (breach of contract) [the clinic, those who fell (ill)]
MC.linkedContent: [Nietzsche’s etymologizing in On Genealogy] méchance (mean, bad, low): bad luck; malchance: Austin’s “infelicity,” parasite (breach of contract) [the clinic, those who fell (ill)]

FL.content: from instituting violence to preserving law/contract [modern democracies] > passage from presence to representation, acc to Benjamin a Verfall, forgetting of originary violence in this differance [Derrida doesn’t see this as accidental?]
FL.linkedContent: from instituting violence to preserving law/contract [modern democracies] > passage from presence to representation, acc to Benjamin a Verfall, forgetting of originary violence in this differance [Derrida doesn’t see this as accidental?]

HERP.content: via Heidegger, Verfall into optics, spectacle, noise > poets, thinkers not tolerated
HERP.linkedContent: via Heidegger, Verfall into optics, spectacle, noise > poets, thinkers not tolerated

A.content: Dasein takes shelter from standing before oneself [in anxiety of death] in gossip (Gerede), far from Unheimlichkeit, structural not accidental modes of Verfallen
A.linkedContent: Dasein takes shelter from standing before oneself [in anxiety of death] in gossip (Gerede), far from Unheimlichkeit, structural not accidental modes of Verfallen

PAS.content: [Blanchot displaces logic of disavowal & denial] pas-de-dénégation doesn’t mean apotropaic can ever be suspended, it is a “double chute,” il garde la chute contre elle-même > perverts up to the limit perversion and its other
PAS.linkedContent: [Blanchot displaces logic of disavowal & denial] pas-de-dénégation doesn’t mean apotropaic can ever be suspended, it is a “double chute,” il garde la chute contre elle-même > perverts up to the limit perversion and its other

PAS.content: those who think denial is a simple gesture are more sheltered (plus abrités) than others
PAS.linkedContent: those who think denial is a simple gesture are more sheltered (plus abrités) than others

S.content: Heidegger rephrases Hegel’s “history of spirit unfolding in time” as “the development of history falls into time”
S.linkedContent: Heidegger rephrases Hegel’s “history of spirit unfolding in time” as “the development of history falls into time”

S.content: Heidegger: factitious existence “falls (fällt)” from originary temporality, from which it has its possibility
S.linkedContent: Heidegger: factitious existence “falls (fällt)” from originary temporality, from which it has its possibility

S.content: [Heidegger appeals to depth (Tiefe) positively, sees destitution (Entmachtung) of spirit/world as a flattening, where dimension has become extension & number]
S.linkedContent: [Heidegger appeals to depth (Tiefe) positively, sees destitution (Entmachtung) of spirit/world as a flattening, where dimension has become extension & number]

DS.content: [quoting Mallarmé] rhythm, literary game par excellence: mimic suspense/laughter—rhythmic cadence, or case, all the falls, the silent fall of pen
DS.linkedContent: [quoting Mallarmé] rhythm, literary game par excellence: mimic suspense/laughter—rhythmic cadence, or case, all the falls, the silent fall of pen

OS.content: can’t extract thematic of Verfallen (re: time in Hegel & Heidegger) from ethicotheological orb, unless l’échéance de l’orbe redirected, in the void, toward un point de chute plus écarté (see DS)
OS.linkedContent: can’t extract thematic of Verfallen (re: time in Hegel & Heidegger) from ethicotheological orb, unless l’échéance de l’orbe redirected, in the void, toward un point de chute plus écarté (see DS)

OS.content: for Hegel, time is becoming/passing away, not simply that in which things pass away > Hegel critiques “fall” into time, intratemporality (Innerzeitigkeit) (but, Derrida adds, this “fall” shouldn’t be denied all dignity, see WM)
OS.linkedContent: for Hegel, time is becoming/passing away, not simply that in which things pass away > Hegel critiques “fall” into time, intratemporality (Innerzeitigkeit) (but, Derrida adds, this “fall” shouldn’t be denied all dignity, see WM)

OS.content: still Platonism in Heidegger’s Verfallen (into time, Being)? > move from primordial to derivative (time) always metaphysical
OS.linkedContent: still Platonism in Heidegger’s Verfallen (into time, Being)? > move from primordial to derivative (time) always metaphysical

OS.content: in analytic of Dasein, relation of fall to proper, authenticity, enigmatic proximity (identity w/ itself of the questioning), concept of finitude
OS.linkedContent: in analytic of Dasein, relation of fall to proper, authenticity, enigmatic proximity (identity w/ itself of the questioning), concept of finitude

P.content: Heidegger on how blosse Ding is only a remainder (not properly determined in itself), a concept formed alongside, w/in, Christian creationism, matter/form, & concept of Überfall
P.linkedContent: Heidegger on how blosse Ding is only a remainder (not properly determined in itself), a concept formed alongside, w/in, Christian creationism, matter/form, & concept of Überfall

P.content: what if Überfall had structure of parergon: violent superimposition that falls on thing, enslaves it, “insults” the thing? but what if…
P.linkedContent: what if Überfall had structure of parergon: violent superimposition that falls on thing, enslaves it, “insults” the thing? but what if…

POS.content: how the “fall,” abasement (of writing) only functions via thought of origin
POS.linkedContent: how the “fall,” abasement (of writing) only functions via thought of origin

ROP.content: instead of “failure” of archaeological principle [of analysis], this principle is destined to limit of its arrest, finitude of its suspense > there’s chance in falling-due, given of fall
ROP.linkedContent: instead of “failure” of archaeological principle [of analysis], this principle is destined to limit of its arrest, finitude of its suspense > there’s chance in falling-due, given of fall

ROP.content: Lacan speaks of the insuccès—Derrida transforms it: “l’insuccès qui échoue à arriver” > playing w/ syntax of to: 1) I do not arrive 2) I fail to arrive because I arrive
ROP.linkedContent: Lacan speaks of the insuccès—Derrida transforms it: “l’insuccès qui échoue à arriver” > playing w/ syntax of to: 1) I do not arrive 2) I fail to arrive because I arrive

ATIA.content: symptom means “fall,” case, coincidence, what falls due (échéance), mishap
ATIA.linkedContent: symptom means “fall,” case, coincidence, what falls due (échéance), mishap

ATIA.content: Derrida not on board w/ Benjamin’s sad, mute nature (animal), because it’s logic occurs after the fall, original sin, in time of redemption
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida not on board w/ Benjamin’s sad, mute nature (animal), because it’s logic occurs after the fall, original sin, in time of redemption

ATIA.content: the 2 falls of man, Prometheus/Adam, narrate (infinite) superiority over the animal: man’s property is unconditional & sacrificial
ATIA.linkedContent: the 2 falls of man, Prometheus/Adam, narrate (infinite) superiority over the animal: man’s property is unconditional & sacrificial

ATIA.content: to not be ashamed of shame: time when Adam called animals’ names before the fall [to think of his shame of shame before his cat, Derrida must call upon this other time]
ATIA.linkedContent: to not be ashamed of shame: time when Adam called animals’ names before the fall [to think of his shame of shame before his cat, Derrida must call upon this other time]

ATIA.content: why would we owe truth anything? the debt of autobiography: confession > after the fall, must already conceive lying as evil, as hiding truth
ATIA.linkedContent: why would we owe truth anything? the debt of autobiography: confession > after the fall, must already conceive lying as evil, as hiding truth

ATIA.content: comparing Genesis w/ Greek myths [re: fault, nakedness] as two symptomatic translations, whose internal necessities partially overlap re: the proper of man [default in propriety]: technics, sociality, emergence out of nature, knowledge, historicity [?], subjectivity, subjugating superiority over animal
ATIA.linkedContent: comparing Genesis w/ Greek myths [re: fault, nakedness] as two symptomatic translations, whose internal necessities partially overlap re: the proper of man [default in propriety]: technics, sociality, emergence out of nature, knowledge, historicity [?], subjectivity, subjugating superiority over animal

ATIA.content: fixity of animal (re: communication, information) is, in Promethean & Biblical myths, related to animal’s perfection: man thus distinguished by lack, theory of man’s fall, fault
ATIA.linkedContent: fixity of animal (re: communication, information) is, in Promethean & Biblical myths, related to animal’s perfection: man thus distinguished by lack, theory of man’s fall, fault

ATIA.content: for Lacan, man’s “autotelic specularity of the inside is thus linked to a defect, to a prematurity, to an incompleteness of the little man”
ATIA.linkedContent: for Lacan, man’s “autotelic specularity of the inside is thus linked to a defect, to a prematurity, to an incompleteness of the little man”

ATIA.content: Lacan designates castration complex as Freud’s scientific (nonmythological) original sin (being subjected to the signifier [nonmastery] gives human mastery over animals) [cf. pp. 139-40]
ATIA.linkedContent: Lacan designates castration complex as Freud’s scientific (nonmythological) original sin (being subjected to the signifier [nonmastery] gives human mastery over animals) [cf. pp. 139-40]

PS.content: for Artaud, history of God is the history of the work as excrement
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, history of God is the history of the work as excrement

FS.content: the project of infinite tradition must be acknowledged as such: that it can always fail is the mark of its pure finitude/pure historicity
FS.linkedContent: the project of infinite tradition must be acknowledged as such: that it can always fail is the mark of its pure finitude/pure historicity

FS.content: “fall” of thought into philosophy, analogical displacement of Being which anchors (retient) and irremediably represses discourse in metaphysics, gets history under way (est entamée)
FS.linkedContent: “fall” of thought into philosophy, analogical displacement of Being which anchors (retient) and irremediably represses discourse in metaphysics, gets history under way (est entamée)

SW.content: as though fate of humanity depends again on who holds power over women about the veil (St. Paul, abusive interpretation of Koran) [sin, fall or Verfallen, therefore the veil]
SW.linkedContent: as though fate of humanity depends again on who holds power over women about the veil (St. Paul, abusive interpretation of Koran) [sin, fall or Verfallen, therefore the veil]

DPi.content: Badinter: courthouse theater, a privileged spectacle, is a failed incarnation
DPi.linkedContent: Badinter: courthouse theater, a privileged spectacle, is a failed incarnation

TB.content: [re: Benjamin’s “The Task of the Translator”] translation as Aufgabe (task)—translator must acquit himself, is at fault, fallen, in error, perhaps a crime: task to render [think reddere rationem, Leibniz], and possible “reconciliation”: Wiedergabe, Sinnwiedergabe (restitution of meaning)
TB.linkedContent: [re: Benjamin’s “The Task of the Translator”] translation as Aufgabe (task)—translator must acquit himself, is at fault, fallen, in error, perhaps a crime: task to render [think reddere rationem, Leibniz], and possible “reconciliation”: Wiedergabe, Sinnwiedergabe (restitution of meaning)

RGE.content: for Bataille, poetry is fallen, retains metaphors from “servile domain,” but is not subordinated because it leads from known to unknown, by way of inner ruination
RGE.linkedContent: for Bataille, poetry is fallen, retains metaphors from “servile domain,” but is not subordinated because it leads from known to unknown, by way of inner ruination

Gi.content: Streuung (a dissemination, a multiplication, not a multiplicity), Zerstreuung the intensive determination of the former—how can it not be contaminated by negating fall in zer-?
Gi.linkedContent: Streuung (a dissemination, a multiplication, not a multiplicity), Zerstreuung the intensive determination of the former—how can it not be contaminated by negating fall in zer-?

Gi.content: for Heidegger, falling, alienation (Entfremdung), and downfall (Abzturz) not those of “moralizing critique”
Gi.linkedContent: for Heidegger, falling, alienation (Entfremdung), and downfall (Abzturz) not those of “moralizing critique”

Gii.content: end of text, in French, sometimes chute or envoi [re: whether Heidegger’s gathering has ever taken place]
Gii.linkedContent: end of text, in French, sometimes chute or envoi [re: whether Heidegger’s gathering has ever taken place]

REST.content: acc. Heidegger, oppositional pairs as Überfall, injure the thing in the thing: hypokeimonon (underneath) or hypostasis/symbebekota (on top) [which becomes in Latin: subjectum (substantia)/accidens], aisthēton/noēton (sensible/intelligible), hylē/eidos-morphē (matter/form-figure)
REST.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, oppositional pairs as Überfall, injure the thing in the thing: hypokeimonon (underneath) or hypostasis/symbebekota (on top) [which becomes in Latin: subjectum (substantia)/accidens], aisthēton/noēton (sensible/intelligible), hylē/eidos-morphē (matter/form-figure)

REST.content: classically, the “thing” is informed matter, Heidegger asks whether this matter/form couple was secretly constituted around thing as work or product (being-product rather than being-thing) > re: Überfall of matter/form couple, has it fallen on the being-thing or being-product? blosse Ding is thing divested of its being-product: what we must think is the Rest
REST.linkedContent: classically, the “thing” is informed matter, Heidegger asks whether this matter/form couple was secretly constituted around thing as work or product (being-product rather than being-thing) > re: Überfall of matter/form couple, has it fallen on the being-thing or being-product? blosse Ding is thing divested of its being-product: what we must think is the Rest

REST.content: that all of a sudden the motifs of Heidegger’s Überfall in REST link up w/ Kant’s parergon in P [cf. P pp. 66-7] is prescribed in all rigor by flexibility of chance, wager, which could have left the place [the link?] empty [edge of frame, place of signature]
REST.linkedContent: that all of a sudden the motifs of Heidegger’s Überfall in REST link up w/ Kant’s parergon in P [cf. P pp. 66-7] is prescribed in all rigor by flexibility of chance, wager, which could have left the place [the link?] empty [edge of frame, place of signature]

REST.content: remainder, instance of letting fall, this lowness: is it the foot?
REST.linkedContent: remainder, instance of letting fall, this lowness: is it the foot?

REST.content: Van Gogh’s scene: “make oneself a present of the remainder (Glas)”
REST.linkedContent: Van Gogh’s scene: “make oneself a present of the remainder (Glas)”

DST.content: Heidegger installs himself upside down in Plato’s mimetology [?], attempts to rehabilitate a mimesis defined as a “disintallation,” as a “fall” that has happened to truth > Heidegger reads alētheia in Republic as Unverstelltheit (installation, non-disinstallation, stele)
DST.linkedContent: Heidegger installs himself upside down in Plato’s mimetology [?], attempts to rehabilitate a mimesis defined as a “disintallation,” as a “fall” that has happened to truth > Heidegger reads alētheia in Republic as Unverstelltheit (installation, non-disinstallation, stele)

DST.content: if one no longer denounces mimesis as fallen, [contra Plato], can’t call it originary: being originary incompatible w/ mimesis
DST.linkedContent: if one no longer denounces mimesis as fallen, [contra Plato], can’t call it originary: being originary incompatible w/ mimesis

HLP.content: radical Christianization of lie as originary corruption of human existence, as Kantian radical evil [Arendt risks secondarizing/banalizing history of lie if she maintains certainty of final victory of truth]
HLP.linkedContent: radical Christianization of lie as originary corruption of human existence, as Kantian radical evil [Arendt risks secondarizing/banalizing history of lie if she maintains certainty of final victory of truth]

AFR.content: for Condillac, [the fact of facts] sensibility/experience due to original sin [historicity?]
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, [the fact of facts] sensibility/experience due to original sin [historicity?]

AFR.content: for Condillac, frivolity as structural destiny, original sin > an accident as essential fate
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, frivolity as structural destiny, original sin > an accident as essential fate

ATM.content: how can Levinas inscribe le tout autre in language of being, of the present, w/in its syntax, lexicon, under its law? > or: cette langue n’est pas d’elle-même déliée, opens to tout autre?
ATM.linkedContent: how can Levinas inscribe le tout autre in language of being, of the present, w/in its syntax, lexicon, under its law? > or: cette langue n’est pas d’elle-même déliée, opens to tout autre?

ATM.content: doing so in a way, where the fault (la faute) [see p. 149 Derrida’s fault, failing], which consists in inscribing tout autre in empire of same, alters the same enough to absolve it of itself
ATM.linkedContent: doing so in a way, where the fault (la faute) [see p. 149 Derrida’s fault, failing], which consists in inscribing tout autre in empire of same, alters the same enough to absolve it of itself

ATM.content: Derrida’s fault/violence against Levinas’ work can only wound Him [i.e. not EL] in his body, He/Il that preseals everything that carries a name > Derrida compares his fault to that of erasing God’s name from a book (a fault that is buried, mourned [not annihilated])
ATM.linkedContent: Derrida’s fault/violence against Levinas’ work can only wound Him [i.e. not EL] in his body, He/Il that preseals everything that carries a name > Derrida compares his fault to that of erasing God’s name from a book (a fault that is buried, mourned [not annihilated])

ATM.content: can one analogize the fault against God’s name w/ fault against any Name? only if analogy functions btwn absolute heterogeneities [?] [theonymic cemetery]
ATM.linkedContent: can one analogize the fault against God’s name w/ fault against any Name? only if analogy functions btwn absolute heterogeneities [?] [theonymic cemetery]

OG.content: for Derrida, writing as violence is originary, mustn’t be abstracted or isolated, not a fall/disease incurred by an innocent language
OG.linkedContent: for Derrida, writing as violence is originary, mustn’t be abstracted or isolated, not a fall/disease incurred by an innocent language

OG.content: for Rousseau, society born by accident to repair the accidental catastrophe (Fall) [birth of supplement] of nature
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, society born by accident to repair the accidental catastrophe (Fall) [birth of supplement] of nature

OG.content: theory of sensible origin of ideas (attention > imagination > pictogram), Cartesian critique of Leibnizian rationalism: no intact theological, metaphysical base
OG.linkedContent: theory of sensible origin of ideas (attention > imagination > pictogram), Cartesian critique of Leibnizian rationalism: no intact theological, metaphysical base

OG.content: sensible origin coincides w/ concept of sign as original sin > if experience is relation w/ plenitude, sign always a sign of the fall [Husserl, Hegel, ontotheology]
OG.linkedContent: sensible origin coincides w/ concept of sign as original sin > if experience is relation w/ plenitude, sign always a sign of the fall [Husserl, Hegel, ontotheology]

OG.content: model of Fall (Platonic or Judeo-Christian) can only be stated w/in common closure
OG.linkedContent: model of Fall (Platonic or Judeo-Christian) can only be stated w/in common closure

EU.content: [in truth, since Descartes sees universal language as impossible] humans are btwn paradise of absolutely natural language & romance of universal transparency: this fall is history
EU.linkedContent: [in truth, since Descartes sees universal language as impossible] humans are btwn paradise of absolutely natural language & romance of universal transparency: this fall is history

EU.content: romance of universal language cannot tell a true story [i.e. is not history]
EU.linkedContent: romance of universal language cannot tell a true story [i.e. is not history]

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s speculation, a logic beyond that of position] the “position’s” fall (chute) would cause bankruptcy, ruin, discredit: today I’ll speak of speculation, I’m betting I will
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s speculation, a logic beyond that of position] the “position’s” fall (chute) would cause bankruptcy, ruin, discredit: today I’ll speak of speculation, I’m betting I will
